name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +20°C. The fluorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their strong electronegativity, estimated at around +10°C each. The hydroxyl group introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The carbonyl group introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The trifluoromethyl group also introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C.
